```{r}
source("sources.R")
calc_energy_poverty_prevalence <- function(
    # poster_charts=NULL
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=NULL,
    metric_name=NULL,
    metric_cutoff_level=NULL
){
  energy_poverty_prevalence <- 
    # as.numeric((poster_charts$metrics$household_count/
    #               (poster_charts$metrics$household_count-
    #                  poster_charts$metrics$households_below_cutoff)))
                     as.numeric((poster_charts$metrics$household_count/
                  (poster_charts$metrics$household_count-
                     poster_charts$metrics$households_below_cutoff)))
  
  return(energy_poverty_prevalence)
}

calc_fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence <- function(
    # poster_charts=NULL,
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=NULL,
    metric_name=NULL,
    metric_cutoff_level=NULL
){
  neb_fpl_wm <- calculate_weighted_metrics(st_drop_geometry(clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp), 
                                           group_columns=c("income_bracket"), 
                                           metric_name=metric_name, 
                                           metric_cutoff_level=metric_cutoff_level, 
                                           upper_quantile_view=1.0, 
                                           lower_quantile_view=0.0)
  
  
  fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence <- as.numeric(
    # ((
    # poster_charts$metrics$household_count-
    #   poster_charts$metrics$households_below_cutoff))
    (neb_fpl_wm[neb_fpl_wm$income_bracket=="All", 
                  "household_count"] -
         neb_fpl_wm[neb_fpl_wm$income_bracket=="All",
                    "households_below_cutoff"])/
      (neb_fpl_wm[neb_fpl_wm$income_bracket=="Above Federal Poverty Line", 
                  "household_count"] -
         neb_fpl_wm[neb_fpl_wm$income_bracket=="Above Federal Poverty Line",
                    "households_below_cutoff"]))
  return(fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence)
}

calc_solar_energy_poverty_denominator <- function(
    # poster_charts=NULL,
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=NULL,
    metric_name=NULL,
    metric_cutoff_level=NULL
){
  neb_fuel_wm <- calculate_weighted_metrics(st_drop_geometry(clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp), 
                                            group_columns=c("super_simplified_primary_heating_fuel"), 
                                            metric_name="neb", 
                                            metric_cutoff_level=metric_cutoff_level, 
                                            upper_quantile_view=1.0, 
                                            lower_quantile_view=0.0)
  
  solar_energy_poverty_denominator <- as.numeric((1-(neb_fuel_wm[neb_fuel_wm$super_simplified_primary_heating_fuel=="Other","households_below_cutoff"]/neb_fuel_wm[neb_fuel_wm$super_simplified_primary_heating_fuel=="Other","household_count"]))/(1-(neb_fuel_wm[neb_fuel_wm$super_simplified_primary_heating_fuel=="Solar","households_below_cutoff"]/neb_fuel_wm[neb_fuel_wm$super_simplified_primary_heating_fuel=="Solar","household_count"])))
  
  return(solar_energy_poverty_denominator)
}

calc_poster_results <- function(
    poster_charts=NULL,
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=NULL,
    metric_name=NULL,
    metric_cutoff_level=NULL
){
  
  energy_poverty_prevalence <- calc_energy_poverty_prevalence(
    poster_charts=poster_charts
  )
  
  fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence <- calc_fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence(
    poster_charts=poster_charts,
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp,
    metric_name=metric_name,
    metric_cutoff_level=metric_cutoff_level
  )
  
  solar_energy_poverty_denominator <- calc_solar_energy_poverty_denominator(
    poster_charts=poster_charts,
    clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp=clean_data_fpl_all_sup_shp,
    metric_name=metric_name,
    metric_cutoff_level=metric_cutoff_level
  )
  
  poster_results <- list(
    "energy_poverty_prevalence"=energy_poverty_prevalence,
    "fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence"=fpl_energy_poverty_prevalence,
    "solar_energy_poverty_denominator"=solar_energy_poverty_denominator
  )
  
  return(poster_results)
}
```

## What is Energy Poverty?

Energy burden is a standard indicator of energy affordability and equity that portrays the proportion of household income that is spent on energy:

\[G = Gross\ Income\ ;\ S = Spending\ on\ Energy\]
\[Energy\ Burden\ (E_{b})= \frac{S}{G}\]

We can improve upon the energy burden framework by assessing __*net*__ energy burdens at a macro-energy systems scale [@scheierMeasurementStrategyAddress2022], but energy burden (**$E_b$**) is a great place to start thinking about energy equity.

We use estimates of energy spending and income for the U.S. residential housing stock to determine how many homes' __energy burdens__ lie below a standard energy poverty line of **$E_b = 6\%$**.

\[E_{B}^{*} = \frac{S}{G} = 6\%\]
